title: Replace C++ with Rust for Systems Programming
suggestion: C++ is dated for teaching systems programming. Rust has modern safety features and is increasingly used in industry. Please consider replacing the C++ component with an introductory Rust course.

meta.rejection_reason: Discrete Math is foundational for understanding algorithms, logic, and computer theory — it remains a core requirement for accreditation.
meta.public_message: We appreciate your feedback, but Discrete Math will stay as part of the core curriculum.

public_updates.message: Your suggestion has been submitted and we are finding an associate editor to review
public_updates.author: System
System
public_updates.message: Your suggestion has been assigned to an associate editor for preliminary review.

title: Add Python Data Structures Module
suggestion: I believe the curriculum should include a dedicated module on data structures in Python, since many students are already familiar with Python syntax. This could make learning more accessible before moving to more complex languages.

public_updates.message: Your suggestion has been submitted and we are finding an associate editor to review
public_updates.author: System

title: Add Python Data Structures Module
suggestion: Given the rise in cybersecurity threats, every CS graduate should have a basic understanding of cybersecurity principles. I recommend adding an introductory cybersecurity fundamentals course for all students.
